body_html: Yeah, you’re right. Thanks for your solution! 发送自 Windows 10 版邮件应用 发件人: Tongzhou Wang 发送时间: 2018年7月5日 22:32 收件人: pytorch/pytorch 抄送: Long Wu; Author 主题: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] subfunction can not use new parameters cover old parameters！！！ (#9178) well 1. obtain_idx_of_tree is a pure python function, so it's not pytorch's problem 2. you gave the default values as empty list, e.g., , idx_tree = []. by python semantics, this will construct a single list object and use that as the default value whenever it is needed, which means that if you mutate that list, the default value will not be an empty list any more. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body_text:
Yeah, you’re right.
Thanks for your solution!

发送自 Windows 10 版邮件应用

发件人: Tongzhou Wang
发送时间: 2018年7月5日 22:32
收件人: pytorch/pytorch
抄送: Long Wu; Author
主题: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] subfunction can not use new parameters cover old parameters！！！ (#9178)

well
1. obtain_idx_of_tree is a pure python function, so it's not pytorch's problem
2. you gave the default values as empty list, e.g., , idx_tree = []. by python semantics, this will construct a single list object and use that as the default value whenever it is needed, which means that if you mutate that list, the default value will not be an empty list any more.
—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body:
Yeah, you’re right.
Thanks for your solution!

发送自 Windows 10 版邮件应用

发件人: Tongzhou Wang
发送时间: 2018年7月5日 22:32
收件人: pytorch/pytorch
抄送: Long Wu; Author
主题: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] subfunction can not use new parameters cover old parameters！！！ (#9178)

well
1. obtain_idx_of_tree is a pure python function, so it's not pytorch's problem
2. you gave the default values as empty list, e.g., , idx_tree = []. by python semantics, this will construct a single list object and use that as the default value whenever it is needed, which means that if you mutate that list, the default value will not be an empty list any more.
—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
